13  package net.sf.oval;
14  
15  import static net.sf.oval.Validator.getCollectionFactory;
16  
17  import java.util.Collections;
18  import java.util.Map;
19  
20  import net.sf.oval.context.OValContext;
21  import net.sf.oval.expression.ExpressionLanguage;
22  
23  /**
24   * Partial implementation of check classes.
25   * 
26   * @author Sebastian Thomschke
27   */
28  public abstract class AbstractCheck implements Check
29  {
30  	private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
31  
32  	private OValContext context;
33  	private String errorCode;
34  	private String message;
35  	private Map<String, ? > messageVariables;
36  	private Map<String, ? > messageVariablesUnmodifiable;
37  	private boolean messageVariablesUpToDate = true;
38  
39  	private String[] profiles;
40  	private int severity;
41  	private ConstraintTarget[] appliesTo;
42  	private String when;
43  	private transient String whenFormula;
44  	private transient String whenLang;
45  
46  	protected Map<String, ? > createMessageVariables()
47  	{
48  		return null;
49  	}
50  
51  	/**
52  	 * {@inheritDoc}
53  	 */
54  	public ConstraintTarget[] getAppliesTo()
55  	{
56  		return appliesTo == null ? getAppliesToDefault() : appliesTo;
57  	}
58  
59  	/**
60  	 * 
61  	 * @return the default behavior when the constraint is validated for a array/map/collection reference.
62  	 */
63  	protected ConstraintTarget[] getAppliesToDefault()
64  	{
65  		// default behavior is only validate the array/map/collection reference and not the contained keys/values
66  		return new ConstraintTarget[]{ConstraintTarget.CONTAINER};
67  	}
68  
69  	/**
70  	 * {@inheritDoc}
71  	 */
72  	public OValContext getContext()
73  	{
74  		return context;
75  	}
76  
77  	/**
78  	 * {@inheritDoc}
79  	 */
80  	public String getErrorCode()
81  	{
82  		/*
83  		 * if the error code has not been initialized (which might be the case when using XML configuration),
84  		 * construct the string based on this class' name minus the appendix "Check"
85  		 */
86  		if (errorCode == null)
87  		{
88  			final String className = getClass().getName();
89  			if (className.endsWith("Check"))
90  			{
91  				errorCode = className.substring(0, getClass().getName().length() - "Check".length());
92  			}
93  			else
94  			{
95  				errorCode = className;
96  			}
97  		}
98  		return errorCode;
99  	}
100 
101 	/**
102 	 * {@inheritDoc}
103 	 */
104 	public String getMessage()
105 	{
106 		/*
107 		 * if the message has not been initialized (which might be the case when using XML configuration),
108 		 * construct the string based on this class' name minus the appendix "Check" plus the appendix ".violated"
109 		 */
110 		if (message == null)
111 		{
112 			final String className = getClass().getName();
113 			if (className.endsWith("Check"))
114 			{
115 				message = className.substring(0, getClass().getName().length() - "Check".length()) + ".violated";
116 			}
117 			else
118 			{
119 				message = className + ".violated";
120 			}
121 		}
122 		return message;
123 	}
124 
125 	/**
126 	 * Values that are used to fill place holders when rendering the error message.
127 	 * A key "min" with a value "4" will replace the place holder {min} in an error message
128 	 * like "Value cannot be smaller than {min}" with the string "4".
129 	 * 
130 	 * <b>Note:</b> Override {@link #createMessageVariables()} to create and fill the map
131 	 * 
132 	 * @return an unmodifiable map
133 	 */
134 	public final Map<String, ? > getMessageVariables()
135 	{
136 		if (!messageVariablesUpToDate)
137 		{
138 			messageVariables = createMessageVariables();
139 			if (messageVariables == null)
140 			{
141 				messageVariablesUnmodifiable = null;
142 			}
143 			else
144 			{
145 				messageVariablesUnmodifiable = Collections.unmodifiableMap(messageVariables);
146 			}
147 			messageVariablesUpToDate = true;
148 		}
149 		return messageVariablesUnmodifiable;
150 	}
151 
152 	/**
153 	 * {@inheritDoc}
154 	 */
155 	public String[] getProfiles()
156 	{
157 		return profiles;
158 	}
159 
160 	/**
161 	 * {@inheritDoc}
162 	 */
163 	public int getSeverity()
164 	{
165 		return severity;
166 	}
167 
168 	/**
169 	 * {@inheritDoc}
170 	 */
171 	public String getWhen()
172 	{
173 		return when;
174 	}
175 
176 	/**
177 	 * {@inheritDoc}
178 	 */
179 	public boolean isActive(final Object validatedObject, final Object valueToValidate, final Validator validator)
180 	{
181 		if (when == null) return true;
182 
183 		if (whenLang == null)
184 		{
185 			// this triggers parsing of when, happens when this check instance was deserialized
186 			setWhen(when);
187 		}
188 
189 		final Map<String, Object> values = getCollectionFactory().createMap();
190 		values.put("_value", valueToValidate);
191 		values.put("_this", validatedObject);
192 
193 		final ExpressionLanguage el = validator.getExpressionLanguage(whenLang);
194 		return el.evaluateAsBoolean(whenFormula, values);
195 	}
196 
197 	/**
198 	 * Calling this method indicates that the {@link #createMessageVariables()} method needs to be called before the message 
199 	 * for the next violation of this check is rendered.
200 	 */
201 	protected void requireMessageVariablesRecreation()
202 	{
203 		messageVariablesUpToDate = false;
204 	}
205 
206 	/**
207 	 * {@inheritDoc}
208 	 */
209 	public void setAppliesTo(final ConstraintTarget... targets)
210 	{
211 		appliesTo = targets;
212 	}
213 
214 	/**
215 	 * {@inheritDoc}
216 	 */
217 	public void setContext(final OValContext context)
218 	{
219 		this.context = context;
220 	}
221 
222 	/**
223 	 * {@inheritDoc}
224 	 */
225 	public void setErrorCode(final String failureCode)
226 	{
227 		errorCode = failureCode;
228 	}
229 
230 	/**
231 	 * {@inheritDoc}
232 	 */
233 	public void setMessage(final String message)
234 	{
235 		this.message = message;
236 	}
237 
238 	/**
239 	 * {@inheritDoc}
240 	 */
241 	public void setProfiles(final String... profiles)
242 	{
243 		this.profiles = profiles;
244 	}
245 
246 	/**
247 	 * {@inheritDoc}
248 	 */
249 	public void setSeverity(final int severity)
250 	{
251 		this.severity = severity;
252 	}
253 
254 	/**
255 	 * {@inheritDoc}
256 	 */
257 	public void setWhen(final String when)
258 	{
259 		synchronized (this)
260 		{
261 			if (when == null || when.length() == 0)
262 			{
263 				this.when = null;
264 				whenFormula = null;
265 				whenLang = null;
266 			}
267 			else
268 			{
269 				final String[] parts = when.split(":", 2);
270 				if (parts.length == 0)
271 					throw new IllegalArgumentException("[when] is missing the scripting language declaration");
272 				this.when = when;
273 				whenLang = parts[0];
274 				whenFormula = parts[1];
275 			}
276 		}
277 	}
278 }
